analysis.summary: The return is approved because the product arrived damaged due to shipping and the customer reported the damage to the carrier on the same day, overriding the standard return window.

policy.reason: This policy outlines the process for approved refunds, and the return is being approved by the shipping damage override.
The package arrived crushed, and the customer reported the shipping damage to the carrier the same day, fulfilling the conditions for this override policy.
There is no indication that the product is subject to a recall.
While the sole is detached, the primary cause is shipping damage, making DMG-4.1 more directly applicable than a general defective item override.
The purchase date of 12/28/2023 is more than 30 days ago, making the standard return window expired. However, this is overridden by the shipping damage policy.

The partially detached sole could be considered a manufacturing defect covered by the 1-year warranty, and the purchase is within the warranty period. However, the shipping damage override is more pertinent to the overall issue.

conflict.description: The General Return Policy (RET-1.1) would deny the return due to being outside the 30-day window, but the Shipping Damage Override Policy (DMG-4.1) approves the return because the damage was reported to the carrier within 48 hours.

resolution.rule_applied: The Shipping Damage Override Policy (DMG-4.1) is a situational override (policy_layer 4), which takes precedence over the General Return Policy (policy_layer 1) and the product-specific warranty (policy_layer 3).

analysis.recommended_action: Process a full refund or replacement for the Alpine Pro Hiking Boots as per the Shipping Damage Override Policy. Ensure documentation of the carrier damage report is obtained from the customer.
